description: Any&nbsp;good bartender will tell you that inspiration for new cocktails can come from anywhere. For Chris Cheng of Westroot Tavern in San Diego, that inspiration came from an unlikely source: the repulsive, slug-like crime boss Jabba the Hutt from the Star Wars franchise.Despite his distaste for puns, Cheng couldn't resist employing some wordplay for this cocktail, which he appropriately named the Java the Hutt.This unique drink features&nbsp;vodka, white crème de cacao liqueur, cold-brew coffee, half-half, and simple syrup, all blended together to create a smooth and creamy beverage that's perfect for any&nbsp;coffee lover.While it may not be the most appetizing drink to look at, it's sure to tantalize your taste.
name: Java The Hutt
recipeIngredient: ¼ oz. Giffard white crème de cacao liqueur

recipeInstructions.name: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker.
recipeInstructions.text: Add all ingredients into a cocktail shaker.

recipeInstructions.name: Add ice and shake again until combined.
recipeInstructions.text: Add ice and shake again until combined.

recipeInstructions.name: Strain over Collins glass and serve over fresh ice.
recipeInstructions.text: Strain over Collins glass and serve over fresh ice.
